columns.Employee_ID: A unique identifier assigned to each employee.
columns.Name: The full name of the employee.
columns.Age: The age of the employee in years.
columns.City: The city where the employee resides.

employee.table_description: The employee table contains basic information about employees, including their unique IDs, names, ages, and cities of residence.

columns.Shop_ID: A unique identifier for each shop in the database.
columns.Name: The name of the shop, typically representing a team or organization.
columns.Location: The city or area where the shop is situated.
columns.District: The specific district or area within the city where the shop is located.
columns.Number_products: The total number of products available in the shop.
columns.Manager_name: The name of the individual managing the shop.

shop.table_description: The shop table is designed to store information about various shops, including their identifiers, names, locations, districts, product counts, and manager details.

columns.Shop_ID: Identifier for the shop where the employee is hired.
columns.Start_from: Year when the employee started working at the shop.
columns.Is_full_time: Indicates whether the employee is working full-time.

hiring.table_description: The hiring table records employee hiring details, including which shop they are associated with, their unique identifier, the year they started working, and their employment status as full-time or not.

columns.Employee_ID: The unique identifier for each employee who has received an evaluation.
columns.Year_awarded: The year in which the evaluation or bonus was awarded to the employee.
columns.Bonus: The monetary bonus amount awarded to the employee for the corresponding year.

evaluation.table_description: The evaluation table stores information about employee evaluations, including the identifiers for employees, the years the evaluations were conducted, and the associated bonus amounts awarded.
